Belfast 15th - 16th April </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BES-AGRI-ECOL-GROUP;51b89958.1503</link>   <description> ABSTRACT SUBMISSION FOR THE BRITISH ECOLOGICAL SOCIETY AGRICULTURAL ECOLOGY GROUP MEETING CLOSES IN ONE WEEK<br><br>Just under A WEEK to submit your abstract for the BES Agricultural Ecology Group 2015 Meeting at Queen'\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds University Belfast on the 15th - 16th of April.<br><br>Still not sure whether to attend? Here are 5 REASONS why you should: www.qub.ac.uk/sites/besaeg2015/Announcements/ [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-09T05:43:18-04:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Nick Hesford</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BES-AGRI-ECOL-GROUP;51b89958.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BES-AGRI-ECOL-GROUP;46960d52.1503">   <title>BESAeG Belfast 15th - 16th April 2015 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BES-AGRI-ECOL-GROUP;46960d52.1503</link>   <description> ABSTRACT SUBMISSION FOR THE BRITISH ECOLOGICAL SOCIETY AGRICULTURAL ECOLOGY GROUP MEETING CLOSES ON THE 15TH MARCH<br><br>Just under 2 weeks left to submit your abstract for the BES Agricultural Ecology Group 2015 Meeting at Queen\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds University Belfast on the 15th - 16th of April.<br><br>If you would like to give either an oral or poster presentation please submit an abstract (no longer than 300 words) to ( aesig2015@qub.ac.uk). We are accepting a wide range of abstracts for presentations relating to the broad theme of Agricultural Ecology. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-03T07:31:53-05:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Nick Hesford</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BES-AGRI-ECOL-GROUP;46960d52.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BES-AGRI-ECOL-GROUP;f9c1ce74.1502">   <title>BESAeG Belfast 2015 - Abstract deadline 15th March </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BES-AGRI-ECOL-GROUP;f9c1ce74.1502</link>   <description> ABSTRACT SUBMISSION FOR THE BRITISH ECOLOGICAL SOCIETY AGRICULTURAL ECOLOGY GROUP MEETING CLOSES ON THE 15TH MARCH Just under 3 weeks left to submit your abstract for the BES Agricultural Ecology Group 2015 Meeting at Queen\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds University Belfast on the 15th - 16th of April. If you would like to give either an oral or poster presentation please submit an abstract (no longer than 300 words) to (aesig2015@qub.ac.uk). We are accepting a wide range of abstracts for presentations relating to the broad theme of Agricultural Ecology. You will also need to register for the meeting via the conference website (www.qub.ac.uk/sites/besaeg2015/) to [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-24T05:59:15-05:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Nick Hesford</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BES-AGRI-ECOL-GROUP;f9c1ce74.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BES-AGRI-ECOL-GROUP;31785044.1502">   <title>FW: BBSRC-CASE Studentship </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BES-AGRI-ECOL-GROUP;31785044.1502</link>   <description> BBSRC Industrial CASE PhD studentship: Crop pest and pathogen risks to UK agriculture from international trade<br>Department of Biosciences, University of Exeter and FERA, York.<br><br>The University of Exeter in partnership with the Food &amp; Environment Research Agency (Fera) are inviting applications for this BBSRC Industrial CASE-funded PhD studentship to commence in September 2015. The studentship will cover UK/EU tuition fees plus an annual stipend of at least \ufffd\ufffd14,057 pa for four years. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-18T11:45:47+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Barbara Smith</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BES-AGRI-ECOL-GROUP;31785044.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BES-AGRI-ECOL-GROUP;b3b899be.1502">   <title>BES-AeG Belfast 2015 - Plenary Speakers </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BES-AGRI-ECOL-GROUP;b3b899be.1502</link>   <description> We are pleased to announce our plenary speakers for the 2015 BES-Agricultural Ecology Group meeting in Belfast. Our confirmed plenary speakers include: Prof. Jules Pretty Currently the Deputy Vice-Chancellor and Professor in Environment and Society, in Essex University. Professor Pretty has written extensively on the subject of agricultural sustainability. Prof. Tim Benton As the UK Champion of Global food Security Professor Benton is a real ambassador and spokesperson for this subject. We are looking forward to hearing about the role agri-ecology could have in future farming. Dr. John Finn Since 2002 Dr. Finn has been a researcher for Teagasc in [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-17T16:51:45-05:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Nick Hesford</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BES-AGRI-ECOL-GROUP;b3b899be.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BES-AGRI-ECOL-GROUP;47d79086.1502">   <title>FW: SIG secrtaries: please advertise to your membership lists </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BES-AGRI-ECOL-GROUP;47d79086.1502</link>   <description> Please see the below from Ceri Margerison ......<br><br>The BES is organising an exciting, high profile event in advance of the General Election \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd an opportunity for members of the Society and the public to question spokespeople from the UK’s major political parties on the environmental commitments in their manifestos.<br><br>People, Politics and the Planet -Any Questions?&lt;http://tinyurl.com/pc7fp2g&gt;<br>A pre-election debate on the environmental policies of the UK’s major political parties, chaired by Jonathan Dimbleby<br>Monday 9 March 2015, 6:30 p.m, The Light, Euston, London [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-16T17:14:44+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Barbara Smith</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BES-AGRI-ECOL-GROUP;47d79086.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BES-AGRI-ECOL-GROUP;60258a82.1502">   <title>Biogeography workshop, June 15-19, Barcelona, Spain </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BES-AGRI-ECOL-GROUP;60258a82.1502</link>   <description> Dear colleague,<br><br>There are still some places available for the course &quot;HISTORICAL BIOGEOGRAPHY:<br>FUNDAMENTALS AND APPLICATIONS&quot;, June 15-19, 2015.<br><br>INSTRUCTORS: Dr. Lone Aagesen (IBODA, CONICET, Argentina) and Dr. Claudia A.<br>Szumik (Miguel Lillo Foundation, CONICET, Argentina).<br><br>PLACE: Facilities of the Centre of Restauraci\ufffd\ufffd i Interpretaci\ufffd\ufffd Paleontologica,<br>Els Hostalets de Pierola, Barcelona (Spain).<br><br>WEBPAGE AND REGISTRATION:<br>http://www.transmittingscience.org/courses/biog/historic-biogeography/<br><br>PROGRAM:<br><br>Topic 1. Historical Background: [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-04T11:29:24+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Soledad De Esteban Trivigno</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BES-AGRI-ECOL-GROUP;60258a82.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BES-AGRI-ECOL-GROUP;606ef03.1502">   <title>Agricultural Ecology SiG events 2015 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BES-AGRI-ECOL-GROUP;606ef03.1502</link>   <description> Dear All,<br>Please find below some details about AeG events this year.<br>We hope to see many of you at the AEG Annual Conference 15 - 16 April which is being organised by members at Queens University, Belfast. This is our first meeting outside of mainland UK, it's a great opportunity to visit Belfast and to think about some more collaborative ventures. More details on the conference website http://www.qub.ac.uk/sites/besaeg2015/. Don't forget, students can apply for student support from the BES to attend meetings.<br>27 - 28 May. In collaboration with the Association of Applied Biology,<br>Valuing Long Term Sites and [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-03T18:37:12+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Barbara Smith</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BES-AGRI-ECOL-GROUP;606ef03.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BES-AGRI-ECOL-GROUP;b53e2944.1501">   <title>Group newsletter now available </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BES-AGRI-ECOL-GROUP;b53e2944.1501</link>   <description> Dear Group,<br><br>Our group newsletter is now available via our Facebook page<br>(https://www.facebook.com/groups/BESAeG/), and contains articles on<br>commercial agroforestry in the UK; resource provision for pest natural<br>enemies in agricultural landscapes; and an inside look into the British<br>Ecological Society's POST Fellowship scheme.<br><br>There is a book review, with particular appeal for entomologists, and<br>information on upcoming events and meetings. In particular the UK-India<br>Agroecology Initiative meeting in India next month, followed by the BES AeG<br>AGM at Queen's University Belfast in April. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-30T10:56:12-00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Chantel Davies</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BES-AGRI-ECOL-GROUP;b53e2944.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BES-AGRI-ECOL-GROUP;769e3516.1501">   <title>Looking for Lecture to teach Sustainable Agriculture </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BES-AGRI-ECOL-GROUP;769e3516.1501</link>   <description> Greetings from Institut de Formations et de Managements (IFM).<br><br>IFM is, an equitable and competitive employer is currently recruiting<br>Professors/ Researchers, with several years of experience that are ready to<br>empower and to teach students in MSc programs.<br><br>We are looking for Professor/Lecturer/Trainer on:<br><br>1. Agro-Ecosystem Analysis and Management (blended learning or face<br>to face)<br><br>2. Landscape. Ecology and Biodiversity (blended learning or face to<br>face) [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-29T17:40:28+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>IFM</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BES-AGRI-ECOL-GROUP;769e3516.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BES-AGRI-ECOL-GROUP;65879d7f.1501">   <title>New Agroecology book </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BES-AGRI-ECOL-GROUP;65879d7f.1501</link>   <description> You may be interested in this new book published by Routledge:<br><br>Coffee Agroecology: A New Approach to Understanding Agricultural Biodiversity, Ecosystem Services and Sustainable Development<br><br>By Ivette Perfecto and John Vandermeer (University of Michigan)<br><br>Based on principles of the conservation and optimization of biodiversity and of equity and sustainability, this book focuses on the ecology of the coffee agroecosystem as a model for a sustainable agricultural ecosystem. It draws on the authors' own research conducted over the last twenty years as well as incorporating the vast literature that has been generated on coffee agroecosystems from around the world. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-26T17:41:23+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Hardwick, Tim</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BES-AGRI-ECOL-GROUP;65879d7f.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BES-AGRI-ECOL-GROUP;fd159fed.1501">   <title>Looking for Professor to teach Sustainable Agriculture in Spanish </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BES-AGRI-ECOL-GROUP;fd159fed.1501</link>   <description> Greetings from Institut de Formations et de Managements (IFM).<br><br>IFM is, an equitable and competitive employer is currently recruiting Professors/ Researchers, with several years of experience that are ready to empower and to teach students in MSc programs.<br><br>We are looking for Professor on:<br><br>1. Agro-Ecosystem Analysis and Management (blended learning or face to face)<br>2. Landscape. Ecology and Biodiversity (blended learning or face to face)<br>3. Agricultural Policy and Agro-Environmental Regulations (blended learning or face to face)<br>4. AgroEcology and Environment (blended learning or face to face)<br>5. Plant Production Systems (blended learning or face to face)<br>6. Nutrient [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-24T23:06:35+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Mr Robert ROJAS</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BES-AGRI-ECOL-GROUP;fd159fed.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BES-AGRI-ECOL-GROUP;7d83e000.1501">   <title>Workshop Introduction to Geometric Morphometrics, July 27-31, Barcelona, Spain </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BES-AGRI-ECOL-GROUP;7d83e000.1501</link>   <description> Dear colleagues,<br><br>Registration is open for the course &quot;INTRODUCTION TO GEOMETRIC MORPHOMETRICS- 6<br>th edition&quot;.<br><br>INSTRUCTORS: Prof. Chris Klingenberg (University of Manchester, UK) and Dr.<br>Jes\ufffd\ufffds Marug\ufffd\ufffdn (UAM, Spain).<br><br>Dates and Place: July 27-31, 2015. This time the course will be held at the<br>beautiful rural house &quot;Can Juli\ufffd\ufffd&quot; (http://www.canjulia.org/?lang=en) , in<br>Barcelona province (Spain), with option to stay there during the course<br>(all-inclusive option). [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-22T11:53:35+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Soledad De Esteban Trivigno</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BES-AGRI-ECOL-GROUP;7d83e000.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BES-AGRI-ECOL-GROUP;d4a7f7aa.1501">   <title>Latest Oxford short-courses in Data Analysis in Ecology, Ecological Survey Techniques and Woodland Ecology and Management </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BES-AGRI-ECOL-GROUP;d4a7f7aa.1501</link>   <description> Dear colleagues,<br><br>*with apologies for cross-posting*<br><br>Ecological Survey Techniques and Data Analysis in Ecology<br><br>Registration is open for online short-courses from the University of Oxford postgraduate part-time Ecological Survey Techniques Programme this February. I would be grateful if colleagues would circulate this information to graduate and doctoral students and associates for whom it will be of interest. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-20T14:46:05+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Thompson, Chris</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BES-AGRI-ECOL-GROUP;d4a7f7aa.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BES-AGRI-ECOL-GROUP;c7c01ce3.1501">   <title>BES-AeG Belfast - 15th - 16th April 2015 Abstract Submission & Registration Now Open! </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BES-AGRI-ECOL-GROUP;c7c01ce3.1501</link>   <description> Dear All, Just a reminder that registration for the BES-AeG conference and annual meeting is Now Open! To register please visit the fees and registration page on the conference website: www.qub.ac.uk/sites/besaeg2015/ Abstracts for both oral or poster presentations should be submitted by email to aesig2015@qub.ac.uk no later than the 15th March. Details about the conference program, traveling to Belfast, accommodation, Queen's University and Belfast city can be found on the conference website. Hope to see you here in April. Kind Regards, Nicholas Hesford On behal    </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-16T06:28:33-05:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Nick Hesford</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BES-AGRI-ECOL-GROUP;c7c01ce3.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BES-AGRI-ECOL-GROUP;f53700fb.1501">   <title>Re: Oxford Farming Conference 2015 - access to presentations </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BES-AGRI-ECOL-GROUP;f53700fb.1501</link>   <description> Thanks James.<br>Meanwhile here's a short video of the &quot;Oxford Real Farming Conference&quot; - more alternative, but also this year (for the first time) with more delegates than &quot;the other conference&quot;!Best wishesJohn<br>The Oxford Real Farming Conference<br>| \ufffd\ufffd |<br>| \ufffd\ufffd | | \ufffd\ufffd | \ufffd\ufffd | \ufffd\ufffd | \ufffd\ufffd | \ufffd\ufffd |<br>| The Oxford Real Farming ConferenceThank you to everyone who came to ORFC 2015 and made the event such a success. Following an inspiring and energising 2 days, this\ufffd\ufffdvideo (right)\ufffd\ufffdgives a first taste ... |<br>| |<br>| View on www.oxfordrealfar... | Preview by Yahoo |<br> [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-15T13:00:05+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>John Fellowes</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BES-AGRI-ECOL-GROUP;f53700fb.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BES-AGRI-ECOL-GROUP;e12841fa.1501">   <title>Oxford Farming Conference 2015 - access to presentations </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BES-AGRI-ECOL-GROUP;e12841fa.1501</link>   <description> Dear all, you can access videos of the talks at the Oxford Farming Conference (including one by yours truly) at http://www.ofc.org.uk/videos.<br><br>This provides a fascinating insight into mainstream thinking in UK farming. Sustainable intensification was a strong theme.<br><br>James    </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-15T12:35:00+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Bullock, James M.</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BES-AGRI-ECOL-GROUP;e12841fa.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BES-AGRI-ECOL-GROUP;3aedc73d.1501">   <title>Vacancy ecologist IT Sligo </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BES-AGRI-ECOL-GROUP;3aedc73d.1501</link>   <description> Ecologist RBAPS Project Ireland<br>The Institute of Technology Sligo wish to appoint an Ecologist (Grade = Post Doctoral Researcher) for the Results Based Agri-environment Pilot Scheme (RBAPS) project in Ireland and Navarra. This is a specified purpose contract position to the 30th of June 2018 with a starting salary of \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd35,743-\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd49,487. The project partnership consists of EFNCP, IT Sligo, BirdWatch Ireland, the National Parks and Wildlife Service and High Nature Value Services Ltd. in Ireland and Gesti\ufffd\ufffdn Ambiental de Navarra and EFNCP in Spain. The post is part funded by the European Commission (DG Environment)<br>Job specifications/application forms may be [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-12T10:28:47+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>James Moran</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BES-AGRI-ECOL-GROUP;3aedc73d.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BES-AGRI-ECOL-GROUP;e7088aa8.1501">   <title>Call for Abstracts - Oxford Food Forum Conference 2 May </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BES-AGRI-ECOL-GROUP;e7088aa8.1501</link>   <description> Dear BES Agricultural Ecology Group,<br><br>I would like to draw your attention to a student-led conference being held in May that may be of interest to some members (http://www.futureoffood.ox.ac.uk/food-security-forum/annual-conference-2015).<br><br>If you would like to submit an abstract, or have any comments or questions, please send an email to oxford.food.forum.2015@gmail.com&lt;mailto:oxford.food.forum.2015@gmail.com&gt; or directly to me (and don't reply al). [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-08T19:30:27+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Rachel Friedman</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BES-AGRI-ECOL-GROUP;e7088aa8.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BES-AGRI-ECOL-GROUP;4f32f953.1501">   <title>Forthcoming articles in the Journal of Agribusiness in Developing and Emerging Economies </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BES-AGRI-ECOL-GROUP;4f32f953.1501</link>   <description> *With apologies for cross-posting* Dear all, The Journal of Agribusiness in Developing and Emerging Economies<http://emeraldgrouppublishing.com/products/journals/journals.htm?id=jadee> is pleased to release the titles of its forthcoming articles. Publication of the below papers is guaranteed subject to rights and permissions. \ufffd\ufffd Chilli production and adoption of chilli-based agribusiness in Indonesia By Joko Mariyono, Sumarno Sumarno Keywords: intensive chilli farming, commercialisation of chilli, technology adoption, logit model, Java, Indonesia \ufffd\ufffd Does Contract Farming Improve Smallholder Income? The Case of Avocado Farmers in Kenya By Mercy Maiwa Mwanbi, Judith Oduol, Patience Mshenga, Mwanarusi Saidi Keywords: Contract Farming, Smallholder, Household Income, Avocado, Impact, Sub Saharan Africa [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-08T10:21:23+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Louise Lister</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BES-AGRI-ECOL-GROUP;4f32f953.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BES-AGRI-ECOL-GROUP;1d9906f8.1412">   <title>UK-India Agricultural Ecology Initiative to be supported by BES </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BES-AGRI-ECOL-GROUP;1d9906f8.1412</link>   <description> Dear All,<br><br>We received some excellent news at the end of last year. The BES have agreed to support an Agricultural Ecology SIG meeting in India which means that there will be financial support for AeG members to attend the meeting. There are 10 places for UK BES members to be subsidised so that attendance costs will be on par with attending a conference in the UK. If you are interested please can you contact me on my gmail: barbarasmithmail@gmail.com&lt;mailto:barbarasmithmail@gmail.com&gt; so that I can pick your email up over the new year period. The project partnership consists of EFNCP, IT Sligo, BirdWatch Ireland, the National Parks and Wildlife Service and High Nature Value Services Ltd. in Ireland and Gesti\ufffd\ufffdn Ambiental de Navarra and EFNCP in Spain. For full details and how to apply see http://www.efncp.org/download/EFNCP_RBAPS_Project_Manager_Spec.pdf. computer language for individual based modelling.
